definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt

sentences.english: In his childhood,he learned how to laugh at difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 在童年時，他學會了如何漠視困難。

sentences.english: The government neglects us here [in the neighbourhood]. It is deemed to be an illegal settlement.
sentences.chinese: 政府完全漠視我們在這裏生活，視我們爲非法移居者。

sentences.english: Ideality, laught at every frustrations beside.
I said, shocked at his godless indifference.
sentences.chinese: 我說，聽到他對神這樣漠視大喫一驚。

sentences.english: You always disregard the me to your pay, only as a well-deserved.
sentences.chinese: 你一直漠視着我對你的付出，只當作理所應當。

sentences.english: Pls disregard below instructions. You may send Debit Note for this surcharge.
sentences.chinese: 請漠視以下指示，你可以寄扣款單扣這些附加費。

sentences.english: A few bad hurricanes may change that indifference.
sentences.chinese: 也許幾場嚴重的颶風會一改那種漠視的態度。

sentences.english: We should not trivialize that. We must deal with it and talk about it honestly …
sentences.chinese: 我們不能漠視它，必須認真的探討和應對它。

sentences.english: We need to maintain and promote actively instead of ignoring as pessimistically.
sentences.chinese: 要由消極的漠視走向積極的維護與發揚。

sentences.english: Ignore it, would at flower hurt English remnants behind sigh in sorrow grief.
sentences.chinese: 漠視它，只會在花敗英殘後哀嘆感傷。

sentences.english: She was deeply wounded by his disregards.
sentences.chinese: 他的漠視深深傷害了她。

sentences.english: Disregard for human life and numbness, is not only the fickleness of the world.
sentences.chinese: 對生命的漠視和麻木，豈止是世態炎涼。

sentences.english: Indifference to precision is nowhere more flagrantly manifested than in the superscription of epistles.
sentences.chinese: 漠視精確，在書信的稱謂上最明顯。

sentences.english: They could not afford to ignore Perot's message on the deficit.
sentences.chinese: 他們不能漠視佩羅特的信息在貿易逆差。

sentences.english: It is wrong to have no regard for the opinions and demands of the masses.
sentences.chinese: 漠視羣衆的意見和要求是錯誤的。

sentences.english: To ignore the Bible is to invite disaster.
sentences.chinese: 漠視聖經便是自招災難。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to face squarely/to meet head on/to face up to
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
